tidbits.title: Small Island Nation
tidbits.description: Tuvalu is one of the smallest and least populated countries globally, comprising nine coral atolls in the South Pacific Ocean.

tidbits.title: Threat of Rising Sea Levels
tidbits.description: The nation faces the threat of rising sea levels, making it one of the most vulnerable countries to the effects of climate change, impacting its land and livelihoods.

tidbits.title: Culture and Traditions
tidbits.description: Tuvalu's culture revolves around traditional Polynesian customs, including music, dance, and craftsmanship, reflecting the islanders' way of life.
